column4: Hello everybody! What is the best way to install 3rd party software? I can't seem to find them using apt-get
depends on what... tho if not in apt, then get some .deb packages.
Its all about permissions and firewalls!
hehe i get this in dmesg:           smbfs: mount_data version 1684370019 is not supported
1st make sure your firewall on the windows machine is allowing connections
eek
hehe i think its cos of ntfs
i guess... I have ntfs on my windows shares and its fine
Have you gotten any windows shares to work?
have you tried using SWAT
nope,
getting it now.
ok, well assuming that you do have folders on your windows machine shared and your firewall configs are set right my best advice is to try SWAT
i do have all that.
SWAT saved my sanity
what is it?
Samba Web Admin Tool
for accessing windows shares too?
another thing I found odd is that besides smbd and nmbd, I also had to run winbind
it will set up smb client and daemon on your computer
I think you may also need a "SMB USER" to be the same exact user that is on your windows machiens
I apologize but it has been a little while since I had to last screw around with samba. Good thing is I guess is once you get it up it stays working :)
I did what doogles said about installing the smbfs on my laptop and doinga  modprobe cifs and it worked fine
